# new Geocoder(options)

**Constructor**

Creates a geocoder object and sets optional language and user location properties.

## Declaration

```swift
constructor(options?: ServiceConstructorOptions);
```

## Discussion

To use geocoding, create an instance of [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Geocoder]. Optionally, you can set the [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/ServiceConstructorOptions/language] and [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/ServiceConstructorOptions/getsUserLocation] properties of a [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Geocoder] object on initialization, as the following examples shows:

```javascript
const geocoder = new mapkit.Geocoder({
    language: "en-GB",
    getsUserLocation: true
});
```

## Creating a geocoder object

- **ServiceConstructorOptions**: Common options you provide when you create a service object.
- **getsUserLocation**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the request returns results near a person’s location.
- **language**: A language ID that determines the language to use for displaying addresses.
